description: Helices Ia and Ib show continuous base-stacking and the bulged U2 snRNA nucleotides U24 and A25 protrude from helix I and bind to the Prp8 RT domain. {Galej:2016ht} (Figs 3d, 4d, e and 5a).

U6-U57C~brC   First, a mutation, U6-U57C, that would disrupt base pairing in U2/U6 helix I nonetheless strongly suppresses a mutation of the branch site adenosine to cytosine (brC) that leads to a defect at the catalytic step of 5' splice site cleavage (McPheeters 1996).
U6-U57C^5'SS  U6-U57C appears to hyperstabilize the 5' splice site cleavage conformation of the spliceosome (McPheeters 1996; Query and Konarska 2004).
